summary: This document is an email chain from March 2020 between an FBI Special Agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding a federal grand jury subpoena served on FirstBank Puerto Rico. The correspondence details attempts to serve the subpoena in December 2019 and January 2020, and the bank's delayed response, with the prosecutor threatening to seek a court order to compel production.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York
persons.context: The FBI agent sends the final email in the chain on March 2, 2020, forwarding the communications and attached subpoena, and asks when the bank will produce the requested materials.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The AUSA is the primary correspondent attempting to serve a criminal grand jury subpoena on FirstBank Puerto Rico, communicating with the bank's customer service and later following up on the delinquency.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The FBI agent and AUSA are working together on the grand jury investigation, with the agent following up on the prosecutor's earlier attempts to obtain bank records.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA is attempting to serve a federal grand jury subpoena on FirstBank Puerto Rico to obtain financial records as part of a criminal investigation.

events.title: Initial Subpoena Submission Attempt
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney attempts to serve a criminal grand jury subpoena on FirstBank Puerto Rico via email, but the bank's system initially rejects it.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Subpoena Served and Received
events.description: The federal grand jury subpoena is successfully served on and received by FirstBank Puerto Rico, with a return deadline of January 15, 2020.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Prosecutor Follows Up on Delinquent Response
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney follows up, noting the bank is delinquent in responding to the January 3 subpoena and threatens to seek court enforcement.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: FBI Agent Requests Status Update
events.description: An FBI Special Agent in New York sends a final email requesting an update on when the subpoenaed materials will be produced.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: Ave. Munoz Rivera N1130, Rio Piedras, PR 00927
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was served on FirstBank Puerto Rico on January 3, 2020, as part of a criminal investigation.
The subpoena had a return deadline of January 15, 2020, and by January 24, 2020, the bank was delinquent in its response with no communication from its legal department.
The prosecutor threatened to seek a court order to compel production if the bank did not respond.
The email chain shows initial difficulties in serving the subpoena via email in late December 2019 due to the bank's secure systems.
The correspondence involves both an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York and an FBI Special Agent, indicating a joint investigation.
